moves.1... f5: The Duras Gambit or Fred Defence.
moves.2... Kf7: This opening move is only good in Kriegspiel.
moves.3... d5: Opening a line to win back the gambited Pawn.
moves.4. Qh5+: Forcing a further weakening of Black's already shattered position.
moves.4... g6: The equally bad alternative was 4... K-B3.
moves.5. fxg6+: If now 5... PxP, Pillsbury wins a piece with 6 QxR.
moves.5... Kg7: Trying to block off the Pawn and find shelter for his King.
moves.6. Bd3: Threatening to win at least a piece with 7 PxP.
moves.6... Nf6: Trying to drive off the powerfully posted Queen, as well as guard the threatened KRP.
moves.7. Bh6+: Adding another piece to the rapidly mounting attack.
moves.8. gxh7+: Opening up the space around the King to allow the Q to penetrate.
moves.8... Nxh7: 8... RxP was the other choice, which would have created a flight square at KR1 for the King and perhaps dragged out the resistance.
